oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Carte de visite of Gen. Ambrose Burnside
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Gen. Ambrose Burnside, who commanded Union forces at Knoxville during the Confederate siege in autumn 1863 against the forces of Confederate General James Longstreet, is photographed in uniform, hatless, and striking a Napoleonic pose. CDV produced by the J. W. Black photography studio in Boston, Mass. Burnside was the commander of the Army of the Potomac until he was removed from command after Fredericksburg and reassigned. His command was sent to East Tenn. in the fall of 1863.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Burnside, Ambrose Everett, 1824-1881
